name: QDefinitionBased
title: Questionnaire is Definition Based
description: If true, indicates that the Questionnaire relies on metadata from the ElementDefinitions referenced by item.definition and that rendering or validating the Questionnaire is likely to be unsafe if the system isn't capable of resolving the definition and using the metadata found there.

element.definition: This identifies the underlying type in a profile, when a questionnaire is generated from a profile.
element.comment: If true, indicates that the Questionnaire relies on metadata from the ElementDefinitions referenced by item.definition and that rendering or validating the Questionnaire is likely to be unsafe if the system isn't capable of resolving the definition and using the metadata found there.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: This identifies the underlying type in a profile, when a questionnaire is generated from a profile.
element.comment: If true, indicates that the Questionnaire relies on metadata from the ElementDefinitions referenced by item.definition and that rendering or validating the Questionnaire is likely to be unsafe if the system isn't capable of resolving the definition and using the metadata found there.
element.requirements: Allows Questionnaires to be defined using definitions and to be safely distinguished from other Questionnaires.
